title: Asian Slaw With Ponzu Dressing
summary: Asian Slaw With Ponzu Dressing is a gluten free and vegan side dish. One serving contains 57 calories, 2g of protein, and 1g of fat. This recipe serves 4. For $1.04 per serving, this recipe covers 12% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It is perfect for The Fourth Of July. 279 people have tried and liked this recipe. Head to the store and pick up snow peas, fennel bulb, sesame oil, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 95%. This score is amazing. Similar recipes include Asian Slaw with Ponzu Dressing, Asian Cabbage Salad with Ponzu Dressing, and Asian Slaw with Ginger Peanut Dressing.

winePairing.pairingText: Asian works really well with Gewurztraminer, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. One wine you could try is Lucien Albrecht Reserve Gewurztraminer. It has 4.2 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 20 dollars.

productMatches.title: Lucien Albrecht Reserve Gewurztraminer
productMatches.description:
The Gewurztraminer Reserve is made from selected (prime) grapes. Bursting with the aroma of honey, red roses and tropical fruit,
yet dry and rich on the palate, this wine is lovely to drink on a warm afternoon by itself or paired in a meal with rich, creamy poultry
dishes. It releases both to the mouth and the nose litchi, rose petal and spice aroma.
